alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 6:58PM EDT until April 07 at 8:23AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Barclay Messerly Road, McConnell East, and Knowlton Roads will be flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM EDT Thursday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest in the next couple hours before falling below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 03/13/1939. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 700 AM EDT.
